0.title: Development in J&K PM Modi's biggest achievement: Jitendra Singh
0.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh hailed PM Modi and called development in J&K his biggest achievement. He said that PM Modi ensured that all the concerns of the people were addressed sensitively. "It is the biggest achievement of PM Modi that in 70 years, each division of J&K has a common allocation for the proposed development projects," said Singh.

1.title: Russian & Turkish Presidents discuss bilateral ties & ending Ukraine war
1.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan held a phone conversation with Russian President Vladimir Putin during which he reiterated Ankara's willingness to play its role in peacefully resolving the war in Ukraine, Erdogan's office said. The two leaders also discussed bilateral ties. Turkey is a NATO member which has rejected sanctions on Moscow but also criticised Russian invasion of Ukraine.

2.title: Man sent to morgue in Australia was alive, tried to get out of body bag: Reports
2.article_body: A 55-year-old man, who was declared dead and sent to a morgue at a hospital in Australia, was alive, reports said. Kevin Reid's body was placed in a resting position, however, doctor reportedly found that the body was lying differently than how the staff had described it. Reports further said that he tried to get out of the body bag.

3.title: Thought me wearing it was funny: Kanye after backlash over 'White Lives Matter' shirt
3.article_body: Rapper Kanye West has addressed the backlash and criticism he received for wearing a t-shirt with the controversial 'White Lives Matter' slogan that's often associated with white supremacy. Kanye said he "thought the shirt was a funny shirt" and that the idea of him wearing it was "funny". He said his father, an ex-Black Panther member, also found it funny.

4.title: CBI files charge-sheet against Anubrata Mondal in cattle smuggling case
4.article_body: CBI has filed a charge-sheet against Trinamool Congress leader Anubrata Mondal before a special court in West Bengal's Asansol in connection with the cattle smuggling case. "During the period 2014-18, Mondal had allegedly accumulated huge properties in and around Bolpur and Kolkata in his name and family members by using illegal cash received in cattle smuggling," CBI claimed.

5.title: Won't be a remote control of Sonia Gandhi: Mallikarjun Kharge
5.article_body: Senior leader Mallikarjun Kharge rejected claims that he would act as a remote control of current Congress chief Sonia Gandhi if he becomes the party's President. "People say I am a remote control...They say I will do what Sonia Gandhi will say. Let me tell you that there is no such thing as remote control in Congress," Kharge said.

6.title: 26 bodies recovered in U'khand avalanche mishap, search on for 3 trainees
6.article_body: A total of 26 bodies have been recovered so far from the site of the avalanche that took place in Uttarakhand on October 4. Reports said that a search and rescue operation is in progress for the remaining three mountaineers. An update by the Nehru Institute of Mountaineering confirmed the number of bodies found on October 4, 6 and 7.

7.title: Felt shy going to male gynaecologist as a teenager: Rakul
7.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh in an interview spoke about her upcoming movie 'Doctor G', which stars Ayushmann Khurrana as a male gynaecologist. She said she felt shy going to a male gynaecologist as a teenager. "When I grew older...I realised that's not how you look at it," she said, adding, "And that's the conversation even in the trailer."

8.title: Not against Adani, but against monopolisation of businesses: Rahul
8.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that he is not "against the corporates but against the complete monopolisation of businesses as that weakens the country". Gandhi's statement came after he was asked about the recent announcement by the Adani Group of investing ₹65,000 crore in Congress-ruled Rajasthan. "Government has not used political power to help Adani in Rajasthan," Gandhi said.

9.title: Policemen make miscreants blow trumpets into each other's ears as punishment in MP
9.article_body: Policemen in MP's Jabalpur made several youths, who were caught blowing trumpets into passersby's ears, do the same to each other as punishment. A video of the incident showed the police telling the miscreants to blow the toy trumpets into each other's ears and making them do sit-ups. The video went viral with many Twitter users lauding the police's action.

10.title: Missile tests are self-defence actions against US threats: N Korea
10.article_body: North Korea on Saturday said its "missile tests are a normal, planned self-defence measure to protect the country's security and regional peace from direct US military threats". The tests don't harm the safety of neighbouring countries and regions, it added. North Korea has carried out six missile launches in 12 days, including launching an intermediate-range missile over Japan on Tuesday.

11.title: Owner suspects neighbour 'poisoned' dog after dog dies in Gurugram
11.article_body: A case was filed after a man alleged that his neighbour poisoned his pet dog after it died under mysterious circumstances in Gurugram, police said on Friday. The owner claimed that the dog used to stray sometimes and the neighbour had threatened to kill the dog. "I've also handed over a packet of poisonous substance that was recovered," owner added.

12.title: Deepak Chahar ruled out of ODI series against South Africa
12.article_body: Team India fast bowler Deepak Chahar has been ruled out of the ongoing ODI series against South Africa due to stiffness in his back. Earlier, Chahar had missed six months of cricket from February to August due to injuries. All-rounder Washington Sundar, who last played an ODI in February, has been named as Chahar's replacement.

13.title: 50 bricks made of 50.23 kg cocaine worth ₹502 cr seized in Navi Mumbai
13.article_body: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) seized 50 bricks made of 50.23 kilograms of cocaine worth ₹502 crore at a Navi Mumbai port. The bricks were inside a container carrying fruits. "This container was brought to India by the same importer...arrested in the case involving the seizure of 198 kilograms of meth and 9 kilograms of cocaine...earlier this week," DRI said.

14.title: Samson, Kishan don't have the X-factor that Pant has: Saba Karim
14.article_body: Ex-selector Saba Karim said Sanju Samson and Ishan Kishan don't have the X-factor that Rishabh Pant possesses. "Pant [is] my first-choice in...white-ball and red-ball cricket," added Karim. "Kishan hasn't made the most of his chances which is why he's fallen down the pecking order...Samson's return to the main team will happen as a batter, not as a wicketkeeper," he stated.

15.title: Tharoor denies rumours claiming he withdrew from Congress President poll
15.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Saturday said that he is "surprised" by calls saying that "rumours from Delhi sources" claimed that he has withdrawn from the party's presidential election. While denying the claims in a video message, he added, "Let me assure you that I don't withdraw from a challenge. Never have all my life and never will."

16.title: Registered labourers in Pune to get ₹4.75 lakh under housing scheme: Maha govt
16.article_body: Maharashtra government would provide financial support of ₹4.75 lakh to registered labourers in Pune under housing scheme, Minister of Labour Suresh Khade said. "The...labourers had to undergo...hardships during...pandemic. Considering that, efforts are being made...to provide [them] homes," he said. The District Collector's office has been told to give information about vacant government lands.

17.title: Identified 250 dengue hotspots in Delhi, will begin door-to-door inspections: MCD
17.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has identified 250 dengue hotspots across the city, where several mosquito breeding sites were found. Special drives, including fogging, sprinkling of larvicides, cleaning of drainage and water bodies etc will be carried out in these areas. The authorities will also carry out door-to-door inspections to check and destroy mosquito breeding sites.

18.title: Flipkart delivery man runs away with 61 gadgets worth ₹4 lakh in B'luru
18.article_body: A Flipkart delivery executive has been booked for allegedly running away with 61 gadgets including iPhones and laptops in Bengaluru last month. The accused, Shaik Babajan, had to deliver the gadgets worth ₹4 lakh in Ganganagar. The operational manager of a logistics company attached to Flipkart said Babajan had been recruited recently. Police have launched a manhunt to catch him.

19.title: US school district suspends entire police force over May shooting that killed 21
19.article_body: The school district in Uvalde, located in the US state of Texas, has suspended its entire police force on Friday, five months after 19 children and two teachers were killed in a mass shooting. "Recent developments have uncovered additional concerns with department operations," a statement mentioned. Two members of the district police department have been placed on administrative leave.

20.title: US limits sale of chip technology to China with new export rules
20.article_body: The US on Friday announced new export controls limiting the sale of semiconductor technology to China with an aim to cripple Beijing's ability to access critical technologies. Alan Estevez, the Under Secretary of Commerce for Industry and Security, said the Commerce Department was working to prevent China's military, intelligence and security services from accessing sensitive technologies.

21.title: 5-6 men gangrape 23-year-old woman in Haryana, shoot her in the leg
21.article_body: Around five to six men allegedly gangraped a 23-year-old woman in Haryana's Rohtak. As per the police, one of the men took the woman to his office on the pretext of giving her a job and raped her along with his accomplices. "When she resisted, they shot at her in the leg," the police said. The woman is currently hospitalised.

22.title: Big game? Not really: India coach Ramesh Powar on match vs Pakistan
22.article_body: India Women head coach Ramesh Powar said they did not consider the Asia Cup T20 2022 match against Pakistan, where India suffered a defeat by 13 runs, as a "big game". "Otherwise, we wouldn't have tried different things...We didn't want our regular chasers to come in...[We wished to] try out someone younger who can take that role up," added Powar.

23.title: Don't understand why Kejriwal & his gang hate Hindu, Hindutva: Kiren Rijiju
23.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju criticised AAP and said that he doesn't understand why Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his gang hate Hindu and Hindutva so much. His remarks came after a video went viral showing Delhi Social Welfare Minister Rajendra Pal Gautam taking part in an event where hundreds took a pledge to convert to Buddhism while denouncing Hindu deities.

24.title: 24-yr-old UP man kills 18-yr-old ex girlfriend, her father after break up
24.article_body: A 24-year-old man killed his 18-year-old former girlfriend and her father after a recent break-up with the woman in Uttar Pradesh. The accused killed them while they were sleeping. The woman's mother was also injured in the attack. The incident took place on Thursday, following which, an FIR was registered against the accused.

25.title: Indian-American envoy tears up during swearing-in administered by US VP
25.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris on Friday administered the swearing-in of Indian-American Shefali Razdan Duggal, who was appointed as America's next Ambassador to the Netherlands. Duggal, who had served as a member of the National Finance Committee of Joe Biden for President 2020, was seen tearing up during the ceremony. "We wish you well in this new role," Harris tweeted.

26.title: Nitish Kumar rejects Prashant Kishor's claim of offering him post in Bihar
26.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar rejected political strategist Prashant Kishor’s claim of offering him a post recently and said that Kishor is working with the BJP. "It's false. Let him speak whatever he wants, we've nothing to do with it. Four to five years back, he had asked me to merge with the Congress," said Kumar.

27.title: It's not like I'm buying a yacht & can't afford it: Elon Musk on Twitter deal
27.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk told Financial Times he is not buying Twitter in a $44-billion deal for the money. He said, "It's not like I'm trying to buy some yacht and I can't afford it." Explaining the reason behind taking the social media company private, Musk reiterated the importance of a "maximally trusted and inclusive means of exchanging ideas".

28.title: Can't think negative if we want to be champions: Yuvraj on Bumrah's injury
28.article_body: Talking about the reactions to Jasprit Bumrah being ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh said, "Are we dreaming of becoming champions? Then, we should not allow any negative thinking." "The batters will have to...deliver," added Yuvraj. "Team India got a wake-up call in...Asia Cup 2022...My gut feeling is that they will do well," he stated.

29.title: TMC files complaint with NHRC over public flogging of men in Gujarat
29.article_body: The TMC has filed a complaint with the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) over the public flogging of Muslim men reportedly by police in Gujarat's Kheda. The men were accused of pelting stones during a garba event. TMC spokesperson Saket Gokhale said it was a matter of shame that the NHRC didn't take a suo moto note of the incident.

30.title: France tells its citizens in Iran to leave 'as soon as possible'
30.article_body: France has urged its citizens in Iran to leave "as soon as possible", citing the risk of arbitrary detention and unfair trial. "The capacity of the French embassy...to provide consular protection to nationals arrested...in Iran is...limited," the French Foreign Ministry said. This step comes after Iranian media had broadcast "confessions" of two French nationals held on espionage charges.

31.title: Kuldeep Bishnoi's son in BJP list for Assembly bypolls in 3 states
31.article_body: The BJP on Saturday announced its candidates for the upcoming Assembly bypolls in Haryana, Telangana and Uttar Pradesh. Bhavya Bishnoi, son of senior BJP leader and former Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi, has been fielded from the Adampur seat in Haryana. K Rajgopal Reddy will fight for Munugode seat in Telangana, while Aman Giri will contest from Gola Gokrannath in UP.

32.title: H'yana man stabs friend to death for asking him to give up drugs
32.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested on Friday after he allegedly stabbed his friend to death in Haryana's Ambala after the latter asked him to give up his drug addiction. The deceased's brother claimed that the accused ran away with the weapon after stabbing his brother in the stomach. The accused was "good friends" with the deceased, the brother also claimed.

33.title: Pune man cheated of ₹2.89 lakh while booking hotel room online
33.article_body: Pune City Police recovered ₹2.89 lakh from an online fraudster who cheated a private company's chief manager while the latter was booking a hotel room online. After booking, he contacted the person on a number he got online. It was the mobile phone number of the accused who took the credit card details and OTP from the man, police said.

34.title: Expeditiously hear Yes Bank's Dish TV EGM plea: Bombay HC to NCLT
34.article_body: The Bombay High Court directed the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) to expeditiously hear Yes Bank's application, asking the tribunal to order Dish TV to convene an extraordinary general meeting (EGM). The Mumbai bench of NCLT will hear the petition filed by Yes Bank and others on November 3. Yes Bank is the largest shareholder in Dish TV.

35.title: 6 liquor, tobacco brands get notices over surrogate ads: Report
35.article_body: The Consumer Affairs Ministry's Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has reportedly issued notices to six alcohol and tobacco brands over surrogate advertising. 8 PM Premium Black, Sterling Reserve, Seagram's Imperial Blue, Rajnigandha Pan Masala, Vimal Pan Masala and Kamla Pasand Pan Masala have been asked to respond to notices for violating the advertising guidelines in a month's time.

36.title: New York hospitals to pay $165 mn to women abused by gynaecologist
36.article_body: Two New York hospitals have agreed to pay over $165 million to 147 patients who accused an ex-gynaecologist of sexual abuse and misconduct. Last year, the hospitals, Columbia University Irving Medical Center and NewYork-Presbyterian, reached a $71 million settlement with 79 of Robert Hadden's ex-patients. Hadden surrendered his medical licence after being convicted on sex-related charges in 2016.

37.title: Brickwork Ratings plans legal action after SEBI orders shut down
37.article_body: Brickwork Ratings, which was asked by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to wind up operations within six months, called the latter's action "shocking". The company said it is considering legal recourses. SEBI instructed it to not take on fresh clients or new mandates for "failure to exercise proper skill, care and diligence...duties as a credit rating agency".

38.title: CCI orders probe into Google's alleged unfair news aggregation practice
38.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has ordered another probe into Google's alleged unfair revenue sharing practices with respect to news content. The News Broadcasters & Digital Association filed a complaint alleging that its members are forced to provide news content to Google to prioritise their weblinks in the Search Engine Result Page (SERP), without getting adequate compensation.

39.title: Speeding car hits bike in MP, throws biker up in air before hitting pole
39.article_body: A speeding car hit a bike carrying three people in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur. The impact of the hit caused one of the bike-borne people to jump up in the air and hit the ground a few metres away. The car also hit a nearby pole after hitting the bike, reports said. The incident reportedly took place on Thursday.

40.title: Huge explosion on bridge linking Russia with Crimea; 7 oil tankers on fire
40.article_body: A fire sparked by a truck bomb has broken out on a key road and rail bridge linking Russia to Crimea. "A truck bomb exploded, setting fire to seven oil tankers being carried by rail to Crimea," Russian news agencies said. Russian President Vladimir Putin unveiled the bridge in 2018, after Crimea was annexed from Ukraine in 2014.

41.title: Was told not to hire Indian-origin people, working mothers: Infosys ex-VP in US lawsuit
41.article_body: A former VP of Recruiting at Infosys has sued the IT major in US accusing it of age and gender bias in its hiring practices. Jill Prejean said she was directed not to hire consultants of Indian-origin, women with children at home, and candidates approaching 50 years of age. Prejean had objected to these practices, but her job was terminated.

42.title: She used to beat me a lot, a ruler got broken on me once: Shweta on Jaya Bachchan
42.article_body: Shweta Bachchan, who has joined her daughter Navya Nanda and mother Jaya Bachchan for the podcast 'What The Hell Navya', said that her mother Jaya used to beat her a lot. "She was very free with her slaps...The ruler got broken on me once," Shweta said. "Abhishek hardly got slapped. I believe always the first child gets thrashed," Jaya replied.

43.title: Rizwan shouldn't listen to anyone: Afridi on criticism over strike rate
43.article_body: Shahid Afridi said Muhammad Rizwan shouldn't "listen to anyone", following criticism over his strike rate. Ex-Pakistan bowler Sikander Bakht criticised Rizwan's knock in a T20I against Bangladesh. "Shan Masood showed intent...He came in the seventh over...At that time, Rizwan was batting on 28. Shan was dismissed in the 12th over...[for] 31. Rizwan...was [then] batting on 38," he stated.

44.title: E-auction of PM mementoes 2022 extended till October 12
44.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced that the PM mementoes 2022 auction has been extended till October 12 this year. "To view the mementoes, visit the National Gallery of Modern Art in New Delhi from 11am - 6pm...The proceeds will be utilised for the Namami Gange project," the Ministry of Culture tweeted.

45.title: Portion of UP's Purvanchal Expressway caves in; 4 people injured
45.article_body: Four people, who were travelling in a car, were injured after a portion of the Purvanchal Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur caved in amid heavy rainfall, officials said. District Magistrate Raveesh Gupta said that most of the repair and maintenance work was completed by Friday morning. The Purvanchal Expressway was inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi in November last year.

46.title: Chile permanently closes mining areas connected to giant sinkhole
46.article_body: Chile's Mining Minister Marcela Hernando on Friday announced the permanent closure of mining stopes directly related to a giant sinkhole that appeared in July. The government is working on recovering water from an aquifer that was damaged by the sinkhole, she added. On Thursday, Chile's environmental regulator announced charges against the Canadian-owned Lundin Mining Corporation for the sinkhole.

47.title: Man rapes 16-yr-old lover, puts her in bag & throws in Assam forest; she walks back home
47.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested in Assam's Cachar district for allegedly kidnapping, raping and attempting to kill a 16-year-old girl. Her family said the accused tried to slit her throat, packed her in a bag and dumped it in a forest, however, she freed herself and walked back home. Police said the girl was in a relationship with the accused.

48.title: How does the RBI plan to introduce Digital Rupee or 'e₹' in India?
48.article_body: The RBI has released a concept note on central bank digital currency, announcing plans to commence a pilot launch of Digital Rupee or 'e₹' soon. A large-scale pilot will be conducted, with users from different income levels, literacy levels, regions, genders and age groups. The Digital Rupee will be designed in a manner that's least disruptive to existing financial system.

49.title: A producer once gave me a blank cheque, I rejected it: Ayushmann Khurrana
49.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana has said that a producer once gave him a blank cheque. "The producer said take the money you want, do three films with us. We'll write the scripts later," Ayushmann added. "For me, the script is very important. I don't want to do anything regressive. I know the popular palette is regressive," he further said.

50.title: Mandate singing National Anthem in all MP schools: NCPCR
50.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has asked the Madhya Pradesh government to make singing of the National Anthem mandatory as part of the morning prayers in all schools. This comes after NCPCR chief Priyank Kanoongo visited CM Rise school in Vidisha and found 'mazars' (tombs) on the campus. NCPCR recommended an FIR against the principal.

51.title: Kapiva launches 4-Balance program to manage weight with Get Slim Juice
51.article_body: Kapiva announced that its 4-Balance program is an Ayurvedic way to manage weight by making small lifestyle changes for long-term benefits. It offers Get Slim Juice, free diet plan, yoga and nutritionist consultation, aiming to improve digestion and metabolism. "Combination of 12 herbs boosts metabolism, reduces fat accumulation to reduce weight as claimed by 90% users," Kapiva's Dr Soni said.

52.title: IAF gets new operational branch for the 1st time since Independence
52.article_body: Chief of Air Staff, Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari, on Saturday said that a new weapon system branch has been approved for the Indian Air Force. He added that this was the first time since Independence that a new operational branch has been created in the IAF. The new branch would result in savings of over ₹3,400 crore.

53.title: Tipu Express between Bengaluru & Mysuru renamed as Wodeyar Express
53.article_body: The Railway Board changed the name of the train connecting Bengaluru and Mysuru from Tipu Express to Wodeyar Express. The change in name comes months after Mysuru MP Pratap Simha met Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in February and made the request. The board also renamed the express train between Mysuru and Talaguppe in honour of the poet Kuvempu.

54.title: Jharkhand records India's highest percentage of child marriages among girls
54.article_body: Jharkhand recorded the highest percentage of child marriages among girls, according to a Ministry of Home Affairs survey. "The percentage of females who got married before reaching 18 years of age is 1.9 at the national level...varies from 0.0 in Kerala to 5.8 in Jharkhand," the survey stated. Child marriages accounted for 7.3% of marriages in rural areas in Jharkhand.

55.title: People supported me because of my character, that was unexpected: Federer
55.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said he was surprised by the messages which he received from a lot of people because of his character, following his retirement, terming it "unexpected". "I thought they [will]...talk about...[my] achievements...It was much more than that. It totally over-exceeded my expectations," added Federer. "People will get a chance to see me again," he stated.

56.title: Chhattisgarh Class 10, 12 toppers get helicopter ride as CM promised
56.article_body: Toppers of Class 10 and Class 12 exams in Chhattisgarh were taken on a helicopter ride by the state government on Saturday. CM Bhupesh Baghel had promised this in May. "We felt really good. It was for the first time that we had a helicopter ride. Other students will also be encouraged to perform well in their studies," said students.

57.title: UK PM Truss fires Trade Min over allegations of serious misconduct
57.article_body: UK PM Liz Truss has fired Trade Minister Conor Burns following allegations of serious misconduct. The Conservative whips' office said Burns has also been suspended from the party's group in Parliament pending an investigation into claims of inappropriate behaviour during the party conference earlier this week. "I'll fully cooperate with...enquiry and look forward to clearing my name," Burns said.

58.title: Mulayam Singh remains critical, put on life-saving drugs: Medanta Hospital
58.article_body: The Medanta Hospital has confirmed that former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav's condition is still critical and that he is on life-saving drugs. He has been undergoing treatment for a kidney infection since August 22. Earlier, PM Modi had spoken to SP chief, Akhilesh Yadav, to enquire about Mulayam's health. He had assured him of all possible help and assistance.

59.title: Mumbai diamond company employee steals 19 diamonds worth ₹12 lakh, booked
59.article_body: A diamond polishing and designing unit employee in Mumbai has been booked after he allegedly stole 19 diamonds worth ₹12 lakh after being asked to work on them. The accused also alleged that his employer had stolen his gold chain. However, reports said that the accused had offered the chain as security till he could arrange the diamonds' amount.

60.title: Give Pakistan credit for beating India which is a billion-dollar cricket industry: Ramiz
60.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Ramiz Raja has said that Pakistan should be given credit for beating India, which is a billion-dollar cricket industry. "India have started giving Pakistan respect as they always perceived Pakistan can't beat them," Ramiz added. Notably, Pakistan defeated India in Super 4 stage of Asia Cup in September.

61.title: Indian Air Force unveils its new combat uniform; pics surface
61.article_body: On its 90th anniversary, the Indian Air Force on Saturday unveiled its new combat uniform. The celebrations, which were held in Chandigarh, featured an air display over the Sukhna Lake. Chief of the Air Staff, Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari, said, "We are also planning on induction of women Agniveers starting next year. Creation of infrastructure is in progress."

62.title: Putin gifted pyramids of melons, watermelons by Tajikistan President on his birthday
62.article_body: Tajikistan's President, Emomali Rahmon, gifted pyramids of melons and watermelons to Russian President Vladimir Putin on his 70th birthday. Videos of the pyramids, which were shared by social media users, went viral. Meanwhile, multiple Ukrainian officials took to social media to denounce the Russian leader on his birthday, blaming him for the war's rising death toll.

63.title: Kevin Spacey pressed his groin against me, I felt frozen: Actor Anthony on when he was 14
63.article_body: US actor Anthony Rapp testified in a court that he was sexually assaulted by actor Kevin Spacey when he was 14 in 1986. Rapp alleged he was in Spacey's bedroom during a party when the actor laid him on a bed and pressed his groin against Rapp's body. "I felt that moment was very long. I felt frozen," Rapp added.

64.title: No promotion to Classes 5, 8 students if they fail annual exams: Delhi govt
64.article_body: Classes 5 and 8 students will not be promoted if they fail to clear annual examinations as per the Delhi government's new promotion policy. The 'no detention policy' was progressive but the education system could not take its full advantage due to lack of preparation, Manish Sisodia said. The new guidelines will be implemented from the academic session 2023-24.

65.title: Crypto investment startup xalts raises $6 million in funding round
65.article_body: Crypto investment management startup xalts has secured $6 million in a funding round. The round saw participation from Accel, Citi Ventures, Polygon Co-founder Sandeep Nailwal, and other hedge fund managers. The company was co-founded in 2022 by former HSBC trader Ashutosh Goel and former Meta Asia executive Supreet Kaur.

66.title: RattanIndia buys Micromax Co-founder Rahul Sharma's Revolt Motors
66.article_body: RattanIndia Enterprises has acquired Micromax Co-founder Rahul Sharma's electric vehicle (EV) manufacturer Revolt Motors for an undisclosed amount. Earlier, the company acquired a 33.8% stake in the EV startup and had an option of increasing its shareholding. Revolt Motors has a manufacturing facility in Haryana and 29 dealerships across the country.

67.title: Pune development authority buys drones to check encroachments
67.article_body: Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) has bought two drones to facilitate its projects and check on encroachments, a PMRDA officer said. With this, PMRDA has become "the only government agency" in Maharashtra to own a drone, the officer claimed. "Drones will help get high-resolution images of areas that can be...developed into 3D images for our projects," the officer added.

68.title: Gurugram man flogs child for 'playing on heap of construction sand'
68.article_body: A case was filed after a man allegedly flogged an eight-year-old child with a stick in Gurugram's Bhondsi for "playing on a heap of sand kept for construction work" and then assaulted his neighbour who came to rescue the child, police said on Friday. The accused apparently beat several children but the child was the one who was badly beaten.

69.title: 'Varna', caste a thing of the past, should be discarded: RSS chief
69.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Friday said that the concepts of 'varna' and 'jaati' (caste) are a thing of the past and should be completely discarded. If today someone asks about these institutions, the answer should be that "it is past, let's forget it", he said. Bhagwat was addressing at a book launch event in Nagpur.

70.title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk offers proposal to resolve China-Taiwan issues
70.article_body: After floating a possible deal to end the Russia-Ukraine war, Tesla CEO Elon Musk has now suggested recommendations to end tensions between China and Taiwan. "Figure out a special administrative zone for Taiwan that is reasonably palatable...probably won't make everyone happy," Musk said. Notably, Tesla's electric car plant in Shanghai accounted for about half of its global deliveries last year.

71.title: India’s forex reserves record lowest level since July 2020
71.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell by $4.854 billion to $532.66 billion for the week ended September 30, Reserve Bank of India data showed. This is the ninth straight weekly drop and the lowest since July 24, 2020. The decline was due to a dip in foreign currency assets which decreased to $472.81 billion from $477.21 in the previous week.

72.title: Heroin worth ₹360 crore seized from Pakistani boat off Gujarat coast
72.article_body: In a joint operation, the Indian Coast Guard and the Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) seized 50 kg heroin worth ₹360 crore from a Pakistani boat off the state's coast, said an official. Six crew members were present on the Pakistani boat Al Sakar, which is being taken to the Jakhau port for further investigation, added the official.

73.title: Arrested for forgery, man escapes police; runs out of Delhi police station
73.article_body: A 42-year-old man, who was arrested in a forgery case, managed to escape from police custody in Delhi. He was being taken for a medical examination. The incident took place on Thursday when the accused escaped the grip of the police and ran out of the main gate of the Badarpur Police Station.

74.title: Ukraine has retaken nearly 2,500 sq km in new counteroffensive: Zelenskyy
74.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday said that Ukrainian forces have recaptured around 2,500 square kilometres of territory from Russian troops in a counteroffensive that began late last month. "This week alone, our soldiers liberated 776 square kilometres of territory in the east of our country and 29 settlements, including six in the Luhansk region," he added.

75.title: List of areas to see power cuts in Bengaluru this weekend released
75.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will see power cuts on Saturday and Sunday, mostly between 10 am and 4 pm, owing to maintenance work by BESCOM. On Saturday, areas including Billekempanahalli, Maruthinagara, Beemenahalli, Ningaianadoddi, Rangegowdanadoddi and Lakshmisagara under Ramanagara division will be affected. On Sunday, Karnataka Industrial Areas Development Board (KIADB) first phase will be impacted.

76.title: Russia takes control of office of 2022 Nobel Peace Prize-winning organisation
76.article_body: A Russian court on Friday ordered the seizure of 2022 Nobel Peace Prize-winning human rights organisation Memorial's office. The court ordered that the organisation's Moscow office "become state property". Memorial won the Nobel Peace Prize along with Belarusian human rights activist Ales Bialiatski and Ukrainian human rights organisation Center for Civil Liberties.

77.title: Man sacrifices 7-yr-old son to 'gain black magic spells' in Bihar
77.article_body: A man was arrested after he allegedly sacrificed his seven-year-old son to "gain black magic spells" in Bihar, an official said on Friday. The accused, who practises witchcraft, strangled his son to death on the night of Vijaya Dashmi, according to reports. "After committing...crime, [the accused] was hiding behind...bushes which are located some distance away from his house," SHO said.

78.title: Gave other batters a chance, backfired: Harmanpreet on India's loss vs Pak
78.article_body: Reacting to India's first loss in more than six years against Pakistan in women's international cricket, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said, "We were trying to give other batters a chance...It backfired." "It was...chaseable...We were not able to...rotate the strike. We played too many dot balls," added Harmanpreet. Pakistan beat India by 13 runs in an Asia Cup T20 2022 match.

79.title: TN Guv approves bill to ban online gambling, regulate online gaming
79.article_body: Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi has promulgated an ordinance to ban online gambling and regulate online gaming in the state. As per the notification, online games providers "shall not provide any online gaming service or allow playing of any online game of chance...with money or other stakes". Last month, the state government approved an ordinance to ban online gambling.

80.title: It's completely man-made massacre: BJP MLA on Jalpaiguri flash flood mishap
80.article_body: BJP Falakata MLA Dipak Barman said that the Jalpaiguri flash flood incident that claimed the lives of at least eight people on October 5 was a "man-made massacre". "The norms have been violated and silt has been excavated from near the pillars of the railway bridge on the river. We will submit our report to the central leaders," said Barman.

81.title: List of world's highest-paid football players released; 23-year-old Mbappé ranks 1st
81.article_body: Paris Saint-Germain player Kylian Mbappé has ranked first on the list of the world's highest-paid football players, with Forbes estimating the 23-year-old will earn $128 million for the 2022-23 season. He's followed by Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, expected to rake in $120 million and $100 million, respectively, this season. The list includes Neymar Jr, Mohamed Salah and Erling Haaland.

82.title: Headcount management startup TeamOhana raises $4 mn in seed round
82.article_body: Headcount management company TeamOhana has secured $4 million in a seed funding round led by Sierra Ventures, with participation from Katalyst Ventures. The funding round saw participation from angel investors and strategic operators, including Notion COO Akshay Kothari, Aurora Solar Co-founder Samuel Adeyemo. The startup was co-founded in 2021 by Tushar Makhija and Baishampayan Ghose.

83.title: US man killed after GPS directs him to bridge that wasn't there
83.article_body: A 47-year-old man in US was killed after the GPS directed him to a bridge that wasn't there. Phil Paxson was heading home after his daughter's ninth birthday when his Jeep fell into a river after the GPS guided him to a bridge that was destroyed in 2013. Reports said there were no barriers or warning signs for the drivers.

84.title: Shoppers Stop signs Yami Gautam for its ‘Nayi Diwali Nayi Soch’ campaign
84.article_body: This festive season, Shoppers Stop aims to celebrate the joy of gifting by breaking away from clichés and choosing to dismiss stereotypes. With a new perspective towards Diwali, it wants consumers to embrace a fresh soch (thought), making it a Diwali to remember, adding that #NayiDiwaliNayiSoch is a stepping stone towards making old bonds stronger with new traditions.

85.title: India reports 2,797 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 29,251
85.article_body: India reported 2,797 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,997 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 29,251 following 3,884 recoveries in the last 24 hours. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 1.05%.

86.title: Boat carrying heroin worth ₹1,200 cr intercepted off Kerala's coast
86.article_body: The Indian Navy and the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB), in a coordinated operation, have intercepted a boat carrying 200 kg of heroin worth about ₹1,200 crore off the coast of Kerala's Kochi. NCB Deputy Director General (Operations) SK Singh said that boat has been seized and its six Iranian crew members were arrested under the NDPS Act.

87.title: Panacea Biotech Founder & Chairman Soshil Kumar Jain dies at 89
87.article_body: Panacea Biotec Limited Founder and Chairman Soshil Kumar Jain passed away on Friday. Jain, 89, had been hospitalised for the past 10 days and suffered a cardiac arrest on Friday. Jain founded the company in 1984 as Panacea Drugs Private Limited. Its name was changed to Panacea Biotec when it was publicly listed on the stock exchanges in September 1995.

88.title: Punjab government regularises services of 8,736 contractual teachers
88.article_body: A notification for regularisation of services of 8,736 contractual teachers in Punjab has been issued, CM Bhagwant Mann said. "CM urged teachers to discharge their duties well for grooming students," CM's office tweeted. This comes a month after Punjab Cabinet gave a nod over the policy framed for regularising services of contractual teachers who have completed 10 years of service.

89.title: TSRTC starts new bus service from Hyderabad to Ananthagiri Hills
89.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) has started a new bus service from Hyderabad to Ananthagiri Hills in the Vikarabad district for tourists. The special bus departs at 8 am from KPHB and arrives in Ananthagiri Hills around 10 am. The return trip starts at 4 pm from Ananthagiri Hills and drops tourists in Hyderabad at about 7 pm.

90.title: Eva Mendes responds after reports claim she quit acting, says 'wanted to be with my babies'
90.article_body: Eva Mendes has responded after reports claimed that she quit acting. Taking to Instagram, she wrote, "I never quit acting. I wanted to be home with my babies and fortunately my other business ventures allowed me to do that more than acting would." "Also, I wasn't excited about the stereotypical roles being offered to me at the time," she added.

91.title: PhysicsWallah CEO's Instagram account disabled, says 'request to reinstate taking ages'
91.article_body: Edtech unicorn PhysicsWallah's Founder-CEO Alakh Pandey said his Instagram account has been disabled "for pretending to be someone else". Criticising Instagram-parent Meta in a LinkedIn post, Pandey wrote, "We have tried contacting several people in the global operations team...but...a simple request to reinstate my account is taking ages." He asked Meta to "connect a responsible person" with him.

92.title: Congress workers detained for wearing 'PayCM' t-shirts in Karnataka
92.article_body: Karnataka Police have detained a few Congress workers for wearing t-shirts with "PayCM" printed on them during the party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra. "PayCM" is an aggressive campaign launched by Congress against the Bommai government, accusing it of massive corruption. Earlier this month, a Congress worker was made to take off his t-shirt that featured the "PayCM" poster.

93.title: Trump would've averted Ukraine war if he was still US Prez: Bolsonaro
93.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said the war in Ukraine wouldn't have happened if Donald Trump was still US President. However, he offered no explanation for how his close ally could've prevented the conflict. Ahead of the first round of Brazil's Presidential election on October 2, Trump had endorsed Bolsonaro, saying he was "one of the great Presidents...in the world".

94.title: 13-yr-old Punjab boy goes missing after cycling 250km to meet Delhi YouTuber, found later
94.article_body: A 13-year-old boy from Punjab's Patiala cycled over 250 km to Delhi to meet YouTuber Nischay Malhan, also known as 'Triggered Insaan'. The boy was reported missing by his family, following which a police search was launched. Nischay, who is currently in Dubai, confirmed on Twitter the boy has been found, adding, "He's now with his family, safe and secure."

95.title: Police book 3 for shooting a man in Gurugram's Arjun Nagar
95.article_body: Haryana Police have booked three people for allegedly shooting at a man in Gurugram's Arjun Nagar on Thursday night. "Doctors told us that he sustained five bullet injuries and that a few of his internal organs were damaged," said the victim's father. All the three accused are on the run and the motive behind the attack is still unclear.

96.title: India will buy oil from wherever it has to: Govt on imports from Russia amid Ukraine war
96.article_body: Commenting on India buying oil from Russia amid the war in Ukraine, Union Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri said, "India will buy oil from wherever it has to," adding that the government has a moral duty to provide energy to people. Puri further said India hasn't been told by anyone to stop buying oil from Russia.

97.title: 57-yr-old saved as live heart transported via green channel in Hyd
97.article_body: A 57-year-old patient with heart failure underwent a successful transplant after a live heart was transported via a green channel created from Yashoda Hospital in Secunderabad to Nizam's Institute of Medical Sciences, Punjagutta. The organ belonged to a road accident victim, 28, who was declared brain-dead at Yashoda Hospital. The traffic police helped provide a traffic-free stretch of road.

98.title: Parts of Mumbai face waterlogging due to heavy rains, yellow alert issued
98.article_body: Several parts of Mumbai faced waterlogging after heavy rains lashed the city on Saturday morning. News agency ANI shared visuals from Sion and Hindmata areas of the city, where waterlogging has taken place. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for Mumbai for Saturday and has said gusty winds and thunderstorms are expected.

99.title: List of 400 apps that may have stolen 10 lakh Facebook usernames, passwords released
99.article_body: Meta has shared a list of 400 Android and iOS apps that were specifically designed to steal Facebook users' login credentials. The apps were disguised as photo editors, games, VPN services, business apps and other utilities to trick people into downloading them. Facebook said it will notify roughly 1 million users that their usernames and passwords may have been compromised.

100.title: Man attacks 14 women wearing saree & bindi, rips their jewellery in US
100.article_body: A 37-year-old man named Lathan Johnson has been charged with hate crimes and robberies in US' California after he attacked at least 14 South Asian women and tore necklaces worth $35,000 off their necks, a district attorney office stated. It added that the suspect attacked women who ranged in age from 50-73 and wore saree, bindi and other ethnic attire.

101.title: Ex-Pune Bar Association head booked in ₹1.35 crore cheating case
101.article_body: A case has been filed against former Pune Bar Association head Satish Mulik and three others in connection with a ₹1.35 crore cheating case. The complainant claimed that Mulik signed an agreement for the sale of land but refused to give the money after the complainant left it at Mulik's residence as it was late at night.

102.title: Sex racket busted at spa centre in Pune, 4 foreign women rescued
102.article_body: Pune City Police has busted a sex racket operating at a spa centre in the Koregaon Park area and rescued four foreign women. Among those rescued, three women are from Thailand and one from Nepal, police said. Police acted on a tip-off and also nabbed two men who were allegedly running a prostitution racket at the centre.

103.title: Constable arrested for stealing ₹10 lakh from businessman in B'luru
103.article_body: A police constable has been arrested for allegedly stealing ₹10 lakh from a businessman in Bengaluru. The accused had found ₹50 lakh cash in the businessman's car while patrolling in the Chandra Layout area. He seized the vehicle and sent the victim to the police station. He took ₹10 lakh out of the total amount and sent to his wife.

104.title: Omar Abdullah falls while playing football in Srinagar school, shares video
104.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah took to social media to share videos of himself playing football with other people in a school in Srinagar. He also fell to the ground in one video. "Took a tumble, dusted myself off...I didn't score, though that wasn't for want of trying. There's always next time," he wrote.

105.title: Canada to deny entry to more than 10,000 members of Iran's IRGC
105.article_body: Canada said it'd ban the top 50% of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) leadership and over 10,000 officers and senior members from entering the country. This comes amid an ongoing "brutal" crackdown on mass protests in Iran over Mahsa Amini's death. "This is the strongest measure we've to go after states and state entities," Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said.

106.title: Delhi govt to organise Chhath Puja at 1,100 ghats with ₹25 cr budget
106.article_body: Delhi government will organise Chhath Puja at 1,100 ghats in 2022 and has set aside a budget of ₹25 crore. This comes after Delhi Revenue Minister Kailash Gahlot on Friday held a review meeting. The Revenue Department will ensure tents, lights, chairs, tables, sound systems, CCTV cameras, LED screens and power backup are available at all the sites.

107.title: Suzlon Energy appoints Vinod R Tanti as CMD for 3 years
107.article_body: Suzlon Energy appointed Vinod R Tanti as the Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) with immediate effect for a period of three years. Vinod Tanti is the younger brother of Suzlon Founder Tulsi Tanti, who passed away due to a cardiac arrest last week. Vinod Tanti was earlier the Wholetime Director and COO at Suzlon and has resigned from these posts.

108.title: Delhi man kills father, injures mother for refusing to lend money
108.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested on Friday after he allegedly stabbed his 65-year-old father to death and injured his mother in Delhi after they refused to lend him money, police said.The accused had demanded money from his parents after he lost over ₹7 lakh in stock market, police added. The accused's mother is critical, DCP (West) Ghanshyam Bansal said.

109.title: CNG, piped cooking gas prices hiked by ₹3 in Delhi
109.article_body: Prices of CNG and piped cooking gas have been increased by ₹3 each in Delhi. CNG rate has been increased to ₹78.61 per kg from ₹75.61 per kg. Meanwhile, price of Piped Natural Gas (PNG) has been increased to ₹53.59 per standard cubic metre from ₹50.59 per standard cubic metre. Prices have also been raised in Noida and Gurugram.

110.title: Putin gets a tractor as gift from Belarus President on 70th birthday
110.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin was gifted a tractor by Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko on his 70th birthday. Putin was given a certificate to say he had been presented with a Belarusian tractor. Lukashenko, who has ruled the ex-Soviet nation for nearly three decades, told reporters he used a model in his garden similar to the one he gifted Putin.

111.title: 11 killed, 38 injured as bus catches fire after it hits truck in Maharashtra's Nashik
111.article_body: At least 11 persons, including a child, were killed and 38 others were injured after a bus caught fire in Maharashtra's Nashik on Saturday morning, officials said. The bus caught fire on Aurangabad road after hitting a truck at around 5.15 am, officials added. "The injured have been shifted to the hospital for treatment," DCP Nashik Amol Tambe said.

112.title: Won't live in a house as part of anti-liquor campaign: Uma Bharti
112.article_body: BJP leader Uma Bharti said she will not stay in a house from November 7, 2022, to January 14, 2023, as part of a campaign against the illegal sale of alcohol in Madhya Pradesh. Bharti said in this period she will live in a hut or a tent. She also praised the state government for starting an anti-liquor campaign.

113.title: 1st phase of Haryana's Panchayat polls to be held on Oct 30 & Nov 2
113.article_body: The first phase of Haryana's Panchayat elections will be held on October 30 and November 2. The ten districts which will go to polls are Bhiwani, Fatehabad, Jhajjar, Jind, Kaithal, Mahendragarh, Nuh, Panchkula, Panipat and Yamunanagar, State Election Commissioner D Singh said on Friday. Polling will start at 7 am and end at 6 pm.

114.title: Developing economies will need to put $1 tn in renewable energy: IMF
114.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Friday said the investment needs of developing countries "solely in renewable energy could reach $1 trillion a year by 2030". The IMF said this funding would ensure the net-zero target of greenhouse gas emissions is achieved by 2050. The IMF said two-thirds of global greenhouse gases are emitted by developing economies and emerging markets.

115.title: We will contest Assembly elections alone: YSR Telangana Party
115.article_body: YSR Telangana Party Founder YS Sharmila on Friday said her outfit will contest the 2023 Assembly polls in Telangana alone in all 119 seats. "We will go solo...we will not ally with the BJP or other parties," Sharmila said in New Delhi. She said the party was formed because there was "misrule" in Telangana.

116.title: Nearly 30,000 use Ahmedabad metro on 1st day after 2 corridors opened
116.article_body: As many as 29,877 passengers rode the Ahmedabad metro on the first day of both of its corridors operating. The North-West corridor, which was opened for the public's use on October 6, connects APMC Vasna to Motera. The Gujarat Metro Rail Corporation said over 10,000 passengers used the metro on the North-West corridor on Thursday.

117.title: Nawaz Sharif's daughter meets him in UK after travel ban lifted
117.article_body: Former Pakistani Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif met his daughter Maryam Nawaz Sharif in London on Friday. Maryam, whose travel ban was removed recently, surrendered her passport to a Pakistani court in 2019 to get bail in a case. Nawaz has been sentenced to 10 years in prison in a property case. He is in the UK for medical treatment.

118.title: Delhi logs 101 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
118.article_body: Delhi reported 101 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.38% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Friday. One death due to the infection was also recorded. The city's active case count stood at 366. Moreover, Delhi witnessed a rise in new cases as 57 COVID-19 cases were logged on the previous day.

119.title: Pakistan's middle order is not performing at all: Inzamam-ul-Haq
119.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Inzamam-ul-Haq said that the side's middle order has not been performing and openers, Babar Azam and Muhammad Rizwan, have taken all the responsibility on themselves. "Pakistan bowlers are performing in the absence of Shaheen Afridi...We can win the tournament if the batting unit kicks in because we have a good bowling attack," the 52-year-old former batter said.

120.title: We are not favourites at WC, there are other teams above us: Messi
120.article_body: Argentina skipper Lionel Messi said that "anything can happen" in the upcoming FIFA World Cup and "favourites don't always" win. "Argentina is always a candidate because of its history," Messi said. He added, "Now even more so because of the moment we're in, but we are not the favourites. I think there are other teams that are above us."

121.title: Why can't a 75-yr-old man have fun: Digvijaya Singh on his dance video
121.article_body: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh danced during the Bharat Jodo Yatra in Karnataka on Friday. Sharing a video of his dance, he tweeted, "Why can't a 75-year-old young man have fun!!" He mentioned that ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah, who is also 75, ran with Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday. "For men, you are as old as you feel," he tweeted.

122.title: Pakistan are over-dependent on Babar, Rizwan: Sanjay Bangar
122.article_body: Ahead of the India-Pakistan match at the T20 World Cup on October 23, ex-cricketer Sanjay Bangar has commented on the composition of both sides. "It's clear that Pakistan [are] over-dependent on their top order like Babar (Azam) and (Muhammad) Rizwan. Whereas the Indian team is not actually dependent [only] on a couple of players," Bangar said.

123.title: Kyrgios retires ahead of Japan Open quarter-finals due to knee injury
123.article_body: Australian tennis star Nick Kyrgios pulled out of the Japan Open minutes before the quarter-finals with a sore left knee. "I actually was dealing with a bit of a knee issue around the US Open time...It's heartbreaking. When the body lets you down, it's not a good feeling," said Kyrgios. He was scheduled to play against third-seeded American Taylor Fritz.

124.title: I wouldn't have made 'Adipurush' without Prabhas: Om Raut
124.article_body: Filmmaker Om Raut said he wouldn't have made 'Adipurush' without Prabhas. "I always had Prabhas in my mind when I was writing Raghav's character. It became so compelling for me. The way he has played it is divine," Raut said. Ever since the film's teaser, which is based on Ramayana released, the makers have been accused of misrepresenting the characters.

125.title: West Bengal logs 150 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1 death
125.article_body: West Bengal reported 150 new cases of COVID-19 and one death due to the infection in the last 24 hours, the health department informed on Friday. The state's active case count stood at 2,026. A daily positivity rate of 2.81% was recorded. West Bengal witnessed a surge in new cases as 69 cases were logged on the previous day.

126.title: Deepak Chahar better skilled bowler than Bhuvneshwar: Harbhajan
126.article_body: Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh said all-rounder Deepak Chahar is a better fast bowler than Bhuvneshwar Kumar. "Deepak Chahar is the only bowler who can get the ball to swing up-front and both ways and looks like getting 2-3 wickets in Powerplay," said Harbhajan. He added that Chahar is, in the "present scenario", a "better-skilled bowler" than Bhuvneshwar.

127.title: Would have been 2021 world champion with extra $300,000: Hamilton
127.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver Lewis Hamilton said if the team had money left over in its 2021 budget then he would have been world champion. "If we had spent $300,000...it would have changed the outcome," said Hamilton, who lost the championship to Red Bull F1's Max Verstappen. Recent reports claim that Red Bull had exceeded their 2021 budget cap.

128.title: How does the Cricket World Cup Super League table read after India's defeat?
128.article_body: After defeating India in the first ODI in Lucknow, South Africa gained 10 points and have aggregated a total of 59 points in the Cricket World Cup Super League. They are currently 11th on the points table, which is led by England with 125 points. Top-seven ranked teams and World Cup hosts (India) will automatically qualify for 2023 World Cup.

129.title: Indian-origin teenager stabbed to death in Israel less than a year after immigrating
129.article_body: An Indian-origin 18-year-old was stabbed to death in Israel, less than a year after he immigrated there. Yoel Lehingahel was killed after a brawl involving over 20 teens broke out at a birthday party in Kiryat Shmona, reports said. A 15-year-old was arrested and seven others, between the ages of 13 and 15, were detained over the incident.

130.title: Govt and LIC together to divest 60.72% stake in IDBI Bank
130.article_body: The Department of Investment and Public Asset Management on Friday invited expressions of interest (EoIs) from potential bidders for strategic divestment of specified government and LIC stakes in IDBI Bank along with transfer of management control. The government and LIC will together divest a 60.72% stake in the lender. Centre will divest a 30.48% stake while LIC will offload 30.24%.

131.title: Don't want to retire at all, will come back from injury: Mary Kom
131.article_body: India boxer MC Mary Kom said she does not want to "retire at all" and will surely make a comeback from her injury. "I want to make a comeback, I have got that guts. Why shouldn't I make a comeback," said Kom. The Olympics bronze medallist added that she wants "to do something for the country again" before retiring.

132.title: 3 children, aged 8-10, drown in pond in UP's Lalitpur
132.article_body: Three children drowned in a pond in Agoura village in Lalitpur, Uttar Pradesh on Friday. The deceased were identified as Chandrapratap Singh (8), his brother Surat Singh (10), and Amit (10), Superintendent of Police (Lalitpur) Gopal Krishan Choudhary said. Notably, the bodies were recovered from the pond and sent for post-mortem, Choudhary added.

133.title: CM announces ₹10 lakh compensation after J'khand woman burnt alive
133.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Friday condoled the demise of a 22-year-old woman who was burnt alive by a man in Dumka for allegedly rejecting his marriage proposal. The CM announced a compensation of ₹10 lakh for her family. The accused allegedly set the woman ablaze after pouring petrol on her when she was asleep. He's currently in police custody.

134.title: 2 youths set off fireworks & obstruct traffic on NH-9 in Ghaziabad, arrested
134.article_body: Two youths were arrested on Friday after they allegedly obstructed traffic by sitting on the roof of a car and setting off fireworks in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. The incident reportedly took place on the NH-9 in the Vijay Nagar police station limits on Thursday. One of the vehicles seen in a video of the incident has been seized, police said.

135.title: Sajid Khan has right to live, don't do drama of quitting B'wood: Payal to Mandana
135.article_body: After Mandana Karimi said she doesn't want to work in Bollywood while talking about #MeToo accused Sajid Khan bagging 'Bigg Boss 16', Payal Rohatgi reacted. "Sajid...has...right to live [and] earn money...You oppose him but don't do...drama of quitting Bollywood," she wrote on Instagram Stories. Mandana earlier alleged that Sajid once asked her to remove clothes during a meeting.

136.title: Told wife 'If Zwigato doesn't work, I will not lose anything': Kapil Sharma
136.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma, speaking about his upcoming film 'Zwigato', said, "I told my wife, if [it] doesn't work, I'll not lose anything. But if it succeeds...then I'll get a lot from it." "Comedy shows are my bread and butter. Because of that...I was motivated to look for something else...I thought the kitchen is safe, let's experiment a bit," Kapil added.

137.title: British minister sacked over allegations of 'serious misconduct'
137.article_body: British Prime Minister Liz Truss on Friday fired Conor Burns, a minister with the trade department, following a "complaint of serious misconduct", Truss's office said on Friday. "The Prime Minister took direct action on being informed of this allegation," Truss's office added. The nature of the allegation against Burns was not immediately known.

138.title: Rare pink diamond sold for world record ₹477 crore at auction in Hong Kong, pics released
138.article_body: A rare pink diamond was sold for HK$453,223,000 (around ₹477 crore) in Hong Kong on Friday, setting a world record for the highest price per carat for a diamond sold at an auction. The 11.15-carat Williamson Pink Star diamond was auctioned by Sotheby’s Hong Kong. The bidding war for the pink diamond lasted 20 minutes.

139.title: New species of beetle named after Novak Djokovic
139.article_body: Serbian scientists named a new species of beetle after ex-world number one men's tennis player Novak Djokovic. The insect, which belongs to Duvalius genus of ground beetles present in Europe and was discovered several years ago in underground pit in Serbia, has been named 'Duvalius Dokovici'. "We feel urged to pay Djokovic back in...way we can," a researcher said.

140.title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin files nomination for DMK President post
140.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Friday filed his nomination papers seeking to contest the election for the post of Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) President. Stalin visited DMK headquarters, Anna Arivalayam, to submit the nomination papers in the presence of senior leaders. The election is likely to be held on Sunday. Notably, Stalin is the current President of DMK.

141.title: CBI files chargesheet against Lalu, 15 others in railway jobs scam
141.article_body: The CBI filed its chargesheet against RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav in the alleged land-for-job scam in Indian Railways on Friday. Lalu's wife Rabri Devi and 14 others have also been named as accused. The case pertains to allegations that prime properties in Patna were allegedly sold or gifted to Lalu's family members in return for railway jobs.

142.title: US, UK hold drone drill in Persian Gulf amid tensions with Iran
142.article_body: The US and the UK held a joint drone drill in the Persian Gulf on Friday. The drill included two American and two British warships and three Saildrone Explorers. The drill was held as tensions between the US and Iran have spiked in the seas recently and amidst stalled negotiations of the Iran nuclear deal.

143.title: Kidnapper, killer of Indian-origin family in US sent them angry texts: Relatives
143.article_body: The man who allegedly kidnapped and killed an Indian family of four in the US had sent them "angry texts or emails" about a year ago, relatives of the family told police. The man, identified as Jesus Salgado, worked for the family, who had a trucking business in California. He had a longstanding dispute with them, police added.

144.title: IAS officers should adopt out-of-box thinking in their work: PM Modi
144.article_body: During his address in the concluding session of the Assistant Secretary Programme 2022, PM Narendra Modi asked the IAS officers to adopt out-of-the-box thinking and a holistic approach in their work. According to an official statement, "PM Modi said that the officers have the opportunity to serve the country during the 'Amrit Kaal' and help realise the five pledges."

145.title: PM to declare Modhera as India's 1st solar-powered village on Oct 9
145.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will declare Gujarat's Modhera as India's first solar-powered village on October 9. The village will be the first in India to be a net renewable energy producer. Solar rooftops installed on more than 1,300 rural houses under the 'Solarisation of Modhera Sun Temple and Town’ project are expected to bring down electricity bills by 60-100%.

146.title: US sanctions Iranian officials for suppressing ‘peaceful protest’
146.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on seven Iranian officials, including two ministers, for allegedly suppressing "peaceful protest" in the country. Female protesters in Iran are agitating against the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was allegedly assaulted by the police over an "improper hijab". Tehran has attempted to end the protests, resulting in the reported death of dozens of agitators.

147.title: 'Real' Rahul Gandhi emerging out of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Cong's Jairam
147.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said the "real" Rahul Gandhi is emerging out of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which completed a month on Friday. "I wouldn't say it is the new Rahul Gandhi, but the real Rahul Gandhi that is being seen," he said. "I think what the yatra has done is to show to...Congress...that we can do it," he added.

148.title: PM not worried about World Bank's forecast, poverty report: Congress
148.article_body: Congress said PM Modi is "hardly worried" and "still indulging in empty slogans and false promises" as the World Bank trimmed India's growth forecast for FY 2022-2023. Forecasting growth at 6.5%, the World Bank said up to 5.6 crore Indians were pushed into poverty in 2020. "Farmers are committing suicide citing PM's inefficiency and apathy," said the Congress.

149.title: Amit Shah's public rallies will change political discourse in J&K: BJP
149.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's BJP chief Ravinder Raina said Union Home Minister Amit Shah's recent public rallies will change the political discourse in the Union Territory. "The enthusiasm of people in both the rallies was unmatched and historic," Raina said. "The Modi government has devoted itself to the welfare of every community in Jammu and Kashmir beyond...region and religion," he added.

150.title: Initially I thought someone from south would play my role: Gauri on Taali
150.article_body: Transgender activist Gauri Sawant has said initially, she thought some actor or actress from the south would play her role in the upcoming web series 'Taali'. "When I was told Sushmita Sen's name, I laughed. Her Chunri Chunri song kept coming to...mind. I...couldn't believe...she would be playing my role at first. But after signing contracts, I was convinced," Gauri added.

151.title: Stones pelted as 2 groups clash during Durga Visarjan in Chhattisgarh
151.article_body: Two groups going to perform Durga Visarjan got into an altercation with each other in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur on Friday. ASP Rajendra Jaiswal said the groups, which belonged to two different Durga Pandal committees, wanted to immerse the idol first. They started pelting stones and also used sticks and rods against each other. An idol of goddess Durga was reportedly vandalised.

152.title: Draconid meteor shower set to light up skies on October 9 &10
152.article_body: The Draconid meteor shower is all set to light up the skies between 9 to 10 October. According to NASA, these meteors are generally faint owing to their relatively slow movement as they enter Earth's atmosphere at just 40,000 mph. Hence, researchers believe, this time, the meteor might appear even fainter due to the full moon rising on October 9.

153.title: Proud that 'Ram Setu' is coming, film proves our rich history: Om Raut
153.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut, speaking about Akshay Kumar's upcoming movie 'Ram Setu', said, "Ramayana is our history, and as...proud devotee of Lord Rama I'm extremely happy since in Ram Setu it's been proved that all that happened wasn't fiction." "I even told Akshay sir that I'm very proud that this film is coming. It proves our rich history," Om added.

154.title: Pic of 'KGF' actor Yash with Lewis Hamilton goes viral
154.article_body: A picture of Kannada actor Yash with seven-time F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton has gone viral. In the photo, 'Charlie's Angels' actress Ella Balinska is also seen posing with the 'KGF' actor and Lewis at the tactical shooting facility Taran Tactical. Yash had earlier uploaded a video of him shooting at Taran Tactical and tagged Hollywood action director JJ Perry.

155.title: Gauri Lankesh's mother, sister march with Rahul amid 'Bharat Jodo'
155.article_body: The mother and sister of late journalist Gauri Lankesh, who was murdered in 2017, marched alongside Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in the Karnataka leg of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Friday. "I stand for Gauri Lankesh and countless others like her, who represent the true spirit of India," tweeted Gandhi. He added that Gauri stood for 'truth, courage and freedom'.

156.title: Fighting Presidential polls to 'save Cong's ideology, principles': Kharge
156.article_body: Senior leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Friday said that he was fighting Congress' Presidential election to "save the party's ideology and principles". Launching his campaign from Gujarat, Kharge said, "This is an internal election...I met the delegates and leaders, who in large numbers have assured to support me." "I am not fighting this election on my own will," he added.

157.title: 2 army personnel killed, 1 injured as tank barrel bursts in UP
157.article_body: Two army personnel were killed and another injured after the barrel of a T-90 tank burst during a field firing exercise in Uttar Pradesh. "The commander and the gunner, unfortunately, succumbed to burn injuries. The driver is out of danger," said an army official. He added that a court of inquiry has been launched to probe the incident.

158.title: UP CM directs officials to speed up relief work in rain-hit districts
158.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has directed district magistrates of the regions affected by heavy rains to carry out relief work on priority. He instructed officials to make arrangements for drainage on priority in waterlogged areas, said an official statement issued on Friday. CM Adityanath also directed the officials to sanction compensation to relatives of the deceased, the statement said.

159.title: Harbhajan alleges illegal activities by Punjab Cricket Association, writes letter to CM
159.article_body: Punjab Cricket Association's Chief Advisor Harbhajan Singh wrote a letter to the association's stakeholders and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, alleging illegal activities by office-bearers. "PCA is trying hard to induct 150 members with voting rights to tilt...balance in their favour and it's being done without...assent of apex council...or without consulting Chief Advisor," the former cricketer wrote.

160.title: 2 women held, 246.95 gm heroin worth ₹50 lakh seized in Assam
160.article_body: Security forces arrested two women from Assam's Karbi Anglong district on Friday for allegedly carrying 246.95 grams of heroin worth ₹50 lakh, police said. Acting on a tip-off, the CRPF and railway police personnel seized the drugs from two women who were waiting at Bokajan railway station, police said. The drugs were reportedly hidden in 20 soap boxes.

161.title: Hong Kong to offer 5 lakh free airline tickets for tourists
161.article_body: Hong Kong recently said that it plans to give away 5 lakh airline tickets to global visitors in order to boost its COVID-19-hit tourism industry. This was confirmed by a spokesperson from the Airport Authority Hong Kong. "Back in 2020, Airport Authority Hong Kong purchased...[the]...tickets in advance from...home-based airlines as part of a relief package," said the spokesperson.

162.title: Sanju lacks experience of playing against a big team: Kamran Akmal
162.article_body: Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal said that India's Sanju Samson "lacks experience when it comes to playing against a big team". "Sanju took his time initially. It would have been a different story if he had attacked right from the start," Akmal said. He added, "There was a lack of intent in the first 30-35 balls that he (Samson) faced."

163.title: ED can't address unemployment and price rise: DK Shivakumar to BJP
163.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar said "political battles must be fought on the political battlefield" after he appeared before the ED in a money laundering case. "BJP must understand ED can't address unemployment and price rise," added Shivakumar. He said that the "misuse of agencies by BJP" will get a "befitting reply" from the people of Karnataka in May 2023.

164.title: Argentine minister resigns after indigenous women evicted from land
164.article_body: Argentina's Minister of Women, Genders and Diversity on Thursday tendered her resignation over the eviction of a group of indigenous Mapuche women from land in the Patagonia region. Elizabeth Gomez Alcorta had criticised the eviction and subsequent arrest of six Mapuche women, one of whom was pregnant. The government has defended the eviction, which was ordered by a court.

165.title: PM scared of offending Chinese Prez?: Owaisi on India abstaining on UN vote
165.article_body: AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi said PM Modi should explain why India 'helped' China by abstaining on a draft UNHRC resolution seeking a debate on the human rights situation in Xinjiang. "Is he so scared of offending Xi Jinping, whom he met 18 times?" tweeted Owaisi. The Indian government said the decision was "in line with its long-held position".

166.title: VFX in 'Adipurush' was difficult to digest: Sunil Lahri
166.article_body: Actor Sunil Lahri, who portrayed the role of Laxman in Ramanand Sagar's 'Ramayan', said it was difficult for him to "digest" the VFX in the teaser of 'Adipurush'. Adding there were no "cartoonish effects" in his serial, Sunil said, "Earlier it was all manual, now it's all presets and they stick to that. They don't want to make any effort."

167.title: Shinde quit Sena, can't claim 'bow & arrow' symbol: Thackeray camp to EC
167.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's camp on Friday told the Election Commission (EC) that the Eknath Shinde-led faction cannot claim the 'bow and arrow' symbol as he and other MLAs in his camp had "voluntarily quit the party". This comes after Shinde's faction submitted a memorandum, seeking it be allocated the symbol ahead of the Andheri East Assembly bypoll.

168.title: Negative people in industry didn't want 'Brahmastra' to work: Karan Johar
168.article_body: Speaking about facing negativity for his film 'Brahmastra' from his own fraternity, filmmaker Karan Johar said being a part of the same industry, people sometimes don't want the film to work. "Sometimes people within the industry, who call themselves members of...media also, celebrate ruination of a film," he said. "You can be critical but being negative isn't nice," Karan added.

169.title: SSC exams only in Hindi, English discriminatory: Former K'taka CM
169.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Friday said it is discriminatory to conduct the Staff Selection Commission (SSC) exams for central government departments only in English and Hindi. He accused the Centre of trying to suppress regional languages. He further demanded that the government must conduct SSC exams in Kannada too, so that "talented people" of Karnataka can get selected.

170.title: Akshay, John, Abhishek, Bobby & Riteish to star in 'Housefull 5': Report
170.article_body: Akshay Kumar, John Abraham, Abhishek Bachchan, Bobby Deol and Riteish Deshmukh are reportedly teaming up for the fifth instalment of the 'Housefull' franchise. The film is expected to go on floors in 2023, report said. Akshay and Riteish have appeared in all parts of the franchise. John, Abhishek and Bobby starred in 'Housefull 2', 'Housefull 3' and 'Housefull 4' respectively.

171.title: Be extra cautious while travelling to India due to crime, terrorism: US in advisory
171.article_body: The US has issued a new advisory warning its citizens to "exercise increased caution in India due to crime and terrorism". It also tells Americans to not travel to the Union Territory of J&K (except Ladakh and Leh), and within 10 km of the India-Pakistan border. It says, "Indian authorities report rape is one of the fastest-growing crimes in India".

172.title: B'wood must make 'Kaho Naa...' sequel with Anil & me: Actor's lookalike
172.article_body: American bodybuilder John Effer, who went viral for having a resemblance to actor Anil Kapoor, has said he wants to act in a Bollywood film. "I feel Bollywood must make a 'Kaho Naa...Pyaar Hai' part 2 with Anil Kapoor and [me]," he added. John further said all he wants is to have a life that's as 'jhakaas' as him.

173.title: Sanju pushed us at the end, but boys stood firm: Bavuma
173.article_body: After winning the first ODI in Lucknow, South African captain Temba Bavuma said that India's wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson pushed them "at the end" but the Proteas players "stood firm". "There wasn't much grass on the surface, we lost a couple of wickets in the middle overs, myself and Aiden (Markram), but the boys knuckled down," Bavuma said.

174.title: Pic shows Team India's 16 backroom staff members for T20 World Cup 2022
174.article_body: As many as 16 backroom staff members are accompanying Team India squad for the T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. The backroom staff is led by head coach Rahul Dravid. The backroom staff includes batting coach Vikram Rathour, bowling coach Paras Mhambrey and fielding coach T Dilip. It also includes media manager Moulin Parikh.
