The others involved in the legal action are actresses Elizabeth Hurley and Sadie Frost, Elton John's husband and filmmaker David Furnish, and Doreen Lawrence, the mother of murder victim Stephen Lawrence.

349.title: Priyanka Chopra shares post on Iran anti-hijab protests over death of 22-year-old
349.article_body: Amid anti-hijab protests in Iran over the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in the custody of Iran's morality police, Priyanka Chopra wrote, "The voices that speak after ages of forced silence, will rightfully burst like a volcano...I stand with you." "Add your voice to this critical movement," Priyanka added. Amini was arrested on September 13 in Tehran for "inappropriate attire".

350.title: Won't attend India-Pakistan match in T20 World Cup 2022, I get into fights: Ramiz Raja
350.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Ramiz Raja has said he won't attend India-Pakistan match at T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. He stated he doesn't watch Pakistan's matches from stadiums as he gets into fights with people. "People are inviting me to attend the first match of World Cup, but I will watch the matches sitting at home," he added.

351.title: Mumbai to witness moderate rains with thunderstorms in next 2 days: IMD
351.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light to moderate rainfall with thunderstorms over Mumbai in the next couple of days. "All India severe weather warnings have been issued by IMD for the coming 5 days…Northern parts of Raigad district, Navi Mumbai, Ratnagiri, ghat areas of Pune and Satara have the possibilities of moderate thunderstorms," said the IMD official.

352.title: Rupee falls to record low of 82.16 against US dollar
352.article_body: The rupee declined to a record low of 82.16 against the US dollar on Friday. It had closed at 81.89 on Thursday. The dollar index, which tracks the American currency against a basket of six major peers, was at 112.032 following a rally after a two-week low. Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty opened in the red amid weak global cues.

353.title: Electronics Mart India shares trading at 60% premium in grey markets
353.article_body: Electronics Mart India Limited's shares are trading at a premium of nearly 60% over the upper price band in grey markets, analysts said. The ₹500-crore public offer opened for bidding on October 4 and the price band was set at ₹56-₹59 per share. On Thursday, which was the second day of offer, the IPO was subscribed 7.57 times.

354.title: Twitter's lawsuit against Elon Musk halted to allow $44 billion deal to close
354.article_body: Twitter's lawsuit against Elon Musk over his $44 billion purchase of the company has been halted to allow the parties more time to close the deal. If the transaction isn't completed by October 28, new trial dates will be set, Delaware Chancery Judge Kathaleen McCormick said. Musk has proposed to buy Twitter for the original price of $54.20 per share.

355.title: Uttar Pradesh should be pothole-free by November 15: CM Yogi to officials
355.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered a statewide campaign and directed officials to make the state pothole-free by November 15, the CM's office said. This comes following a high-level meeting held on Thursday. "Good roads and better connectivity are everyone's rights," he said. CM Adityanath also reviewed the preparations for the 81st session of the Indian Road Congress (IRC).

356.title: Man claims Flipkart sent iPhone 14 instead of iPhone 13 to customer; shares pics
356.article_body: A Twitter user has claimed that Flipkart sent iPhone 14 to one of his followers who had ordered iPhone 13 on the e-commerce platform. The man shared pictures of the order summary and the product received by the customer. While several people on Twitter called the customer 'lucky', a user wrote, "So even Flipkart knows it's the same phone."

357.title: Gang of women surround woman on Gurugram road, steal purse with ₹15000
357.article_body: A gang of women dressed in white sarees allegedly stole another woman's purse which had ₹15000 cash, her phone and documents like PAN and Aadhaar card. The incident took place when the accused women surrounded the victim on a road in Gurugram amid the Dussehra rush. "All of the suspects dispersed immediately after the theft," police said.

358.title: US Prez Biden pardons thousands convicted of marijuana possession
358.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday pardoned all people with federal convictions for "simple possession" of marijuana. There are thousands of people who've prior federal convictions, who may be denied employment, housing or educational opportunities, and this move would relieve such "collateral" consequences, Biden said.  "No one should be in jail just for using or possessing marijuana," he added.

359.title: 22 kids killed by gunman in mass shooting at Thailand daycare were sleeping
359.article_body: The 22 kids who were killed by a gunman in mass shooting at a daycare in Thailand were sleeping, according to Piyalak Kingkaew, who led the rescue team that was the first to arrive. "Nobody wants this to happen. It's a scene that nobody wants to see. It's harrowing," Kingkaew added. The attacker later killed himself.

360.title: B'luru to get 4 multi-speciality hospitals, 243 Namma Clinics: CM
360.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that four multi-speciality hospitals and 243 Namma Clinics will be set up in Bengaluru. "20 PHCs (primary health centres) will also be upgraded. ₹500 crore has been earmarked to provide cochlear implantation free of cost for the poor," he added. Bommai inaugurated a 50-bed subcentre of the Jayadeva Institute of Cardiology.

361.title: Man who impersonated woman on social media arrested in Gr Noida
361.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested in Greater Noida for allegedly setting up fake social media accounts impersonating his female friend and posting inappropriate pictures, police said. The accused had befriended the woman six years ago but she got married to someone else, a police official said. "[The accused] also called...[woman's] husband and hurled abuses at him," the police official added.

362.title: Nuclear 'Armageddon' risk highest since 1962, Putin is not joking: US President
362.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that the risk of nuclear 'Armageddon' is at the highest level since the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis. "[Russian President Vladimir Putin] is not joking when he talks about potential use of tactical nuclear weapons or biological and chemical weapons," Biden warned. The threat from Putin is real "because his military is...significantly underperforming", he added.

363.title: IMD issues moderate rainfall warning for Pune for next 2 days
363.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Thursday issued a warning for moderate rainfall over Pune and its neighbouring areas for the next two days. Pune and other districts will witness thunderstorms, lightning and rainfall till October 8, it added. "Due to (a) cyclonic circulation, moisture-laden winds...being pulled from the Arabian Sea and Bay of Bengal over Maharashtra," an official said.

364.title: Started rescuing but there was little we could do: U'khand avalanche survivor
364.article_body: Naib Subedar Anil Kumar, a survivor in Uttarakhand avalanche incident that took place on October 4, said that the avalanche unhooked three to four ropes and those who were anchored to the ropes fell into the crevasse. "When the snow began to settle...I undid ropes and started to rescue my teammates. However, there was little we could do," he said.

365.title: Pune man makes hoax call about plot to kill PM to frame neighbours
365.article_body: A 38-year-old man was arrested from Pune's Dehu road area after he made a hoax call claiming that a plot was being hatched in a flat to kill PM Narendra Modi. The accused allegedly made the call to "teach a lesson" to his neighbours as he was annoyed by the noise made by their children, a police official said.

366.title: Veteran actor Arun Bali passes away aged 79
366.article_body: Veteran actor Arun Bali, who has worked in films like '3 Idiots', 'PK', 'Kedarnath' and 'Panipat', passed away at the age of 79 on Friday, news agency ANI reported. He was diagnosed with a rare neuromuscular disease called myasthenia gravis in January this year. Bali's last film 'Goodbye', starring Amitabh Bachchan and Neena Gupta, is set to be released today.

367.title: India abstains from voting at UNHRC on holding debate on China's treatment of Uyghurs
367.article_body: India on Thursday abstained from voting at UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC) on holding a debate on China's treatment of Uyghur Muslims in Xinjiang. The draft resolution on "holding a debate on the situation of human rights in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China" was rejected after 17 members voted in favour, 19 members voted against and 11 abstentions.

368.title: Two 17-yr-old boys stabbed to death in Delhi, 3 minors apprehended
368.article_body: Police apprehended three minors after two boys aged around 17 were stabbed to death in Delhi's Mukundpur. A 17-year-old girl who lives in the neighbourhood called the victims on Wednesday night, police said. The girl was with her brother and two friends, and when the victims reached the spot, an altercation took place between the two sides, police added.

369.title: Women engage in fight, pull each other's hair in Thane local; video surfaces
369.article_body: An argument between two women on board Thane-Panvel local train turned violent after they started thrashing each other. A video of the incident that reportedly took place on Wednesday evening has surfaced on social media. The women are seen pulling each other's hair and raining slaps on each other in the video.

370.title: 60-yr-old woman dies after falling into open drain in Delhi's Dwarka
370.article_body: A 60-year-old woman fell into an open drain in Delhi's Dwarka on Wednesday, police said. The incident took place at around 7:00 pm in Sector 13 near a Reliance Fresh outlet. The woman, identified as Sudha Devi, was taken to a hospital where she passed away, police said. A case has been registered for causing death by negligence.

371.title: ₹8.81 crore fine collected from traffic violators in Gurugram till August 2022
371.article_body: Gurugram Traffic Police said they have collected ₹8.81 crore as fines from around 8 lakh traffic violators between January and August this year. As per police, most of these challans have been issued for driving in the wrong direction, followed by for driving without high-security number plates, no entry, excess seating capacity, dangerous driving, using black films etc.

372.title: Clear Dalit sanitation workers' dues worth ₹16 cr: Delhi L-G to AAP govt
372.article_body: Delhi L-G VK Saxena on Thursday directed the Chief Secretary to clear all dues of Dalit sanitation workers before Diwali. The order came after Dalit Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry cited non-payment of bills to over 1,000 workers to the tune of ₹16 crore by Delhi government. The workers have reportedly not received their dues over last four years.

373.title: Credit Suisse is seeking outside investor for investment bank spin-off: Reports
373.article_body: According to reports, Credit Suisse is trying to bring an outside investor to provide funds for a spin-off of its advisory and investment banking businesses. The bank is looking for advisory and deal-making teams alongside the leveraged finance unit for its new boutique-like firm. Sources said talks on reviving the First Boston name for the spun-out businesses are also advancing.

374.title: Nykaa joins hands with Dubai's Apparel Group for strategic alliance
374.article_body: Indian cosmetics brand Nykaa entered a strategic alliance with Dubai-based lifestyle brand Apparel Group to expand in Gulf countries. Nykaa Chief Executive Falguni Nayar said the two companies will together build a multi-brand beauty retail business in Gulf Cooperation Council countries. Nykaa said that the upcoming festival season has already given a glimpse of consumer demand recovery.

375.title: Govt gets ₹1,203 crore dividend from 5 Central Public Sector Enterprises
375.article_body: The government has received ₹1,203 crore as dividend tranches from five Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSE). The total dividend receipts of the government from CPSEs now stand at ₹14,778 crore in this fiscal. Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey tweeted that SAIL, HUDCO and IREL paid ₹604 crore, ₹450 crore and ₹37 crore respectively.

376.title: Sanju Samson smashes his highest score in ODI cricket
376.article_body: Sanju Samson on Thursday slammed an unbeaten 86 off 63 deliveries in the first ODI against South Africa in Lucknow. It is Samson's highest score in ODI cricket. The 27-year-old wicketkeeper-batter's previous highest score was 54(51), which came against West Indies in July. In his seven ODI innings, Samson has crossed 40 four times.

377.title: False: Tharoor on rumours of him backing out of Congress Prez poll
377.article_body: MP Shashi Tharoor on Thursday stated that rumours of him withdrawing his nomination from the Congress President election are false. "I'm receiving so much support that if I wouldn't have been democratically inclined, I would have asked the other candidate to withdraw," he added. He called the election a "friendly contest". Mallikarjun Kharge is the other candidate for the post.

378.title: I picturise Ravana like this: Adipurush director on comparison of his Ravana with Khilji
378.article_body: Director Om Raut has defended the portrayal of Ravana in 'Adipurush' after many compared Saif's look to Ranveer Singh's Khilji in 'Padmaavat'. Raut said, "The Ravana that we saw earlier was an artistic representation of the evil that Ravana was. My Ravana is demonic too, but in today's time, if I picturise Ravana like this, then that is it."

379.title: 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' becomes fastest film in history to gross ₹100 crore in Tamil Nadu
379.article_body: Mani Ratnam-directorial 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' has created history by becoming the fastest film to gross ₹100 crore in Tamil Nadu box office. The film crossed the ₹100 crore mark in Tamil Nadu within five days of its release, breaking the previous record of seven days set by 'Sarkar' and 'Bigil'.

380.title: Harshad Ribadiya joins BJP days after resigning from Congress
380.article_body: Patidar community leader Harshad Ribadiya joined the BJP on Thursday, two days after resigning from the Gujarat Assembly as a Congress MLA. He was inducted during a function organised at the BJP's state headquarters 'Kamalam'. Several local Congress leaders, including Junagadh district Congress President, Mehsana taluka Congress President and Kisan Morcha leaders, also joined BJP during the event.

381.title: 22 killed as two migrant boats sink off the coast of Greece
381.article_body: Two boats carrying illegal migrants sank off the coast of Greece late on Wednesday night, resulting in the death of at least 22 people with many missing. The two vessels sank hundreds of miles apart. Rescue efforts in one of the incidents saw residents and firefighters pulling out migrants from the edge of steep cliffs.

382.title: 16 killed, 24 injured in bus accident in Nepal
382.article_body: At least 16 people were killed and 24 people were injured in a bus accident in southern Nepal's Bara District on Thursday. At the time of the accident, the bus was transporting people from the Dashain festival in Narayangadh in Chitwan district to Pathlaiya in Bara district. According to reports, the bus was carrying more passengers than its capacity.

383.title: Sonia, Rahul help girl after she falls during Bharat Jodo Yatra
383.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi helped a girl who fell down during the Bharat Jodo Yatra in Karnataka's Mandya on Thursday. Sharing a video of the incident, Congress tweeted, "We care!" The video, which has gone viral on social media, shows Sonia Gandhi giving a back rub to the girl. The child bore a Tricolour in her hands.

384.title: Don't kill or get killed, contribute to Kashmir's development: Athawale to terrorists
384.article_body: Union minister Ramdas Athawale on Thursday appealed to terrorists to neither kill nor get killed and instead contribute to the development of Kashmir. "Kashmir is a beautiful place...The government is trying to boost tourism so that it creates more employment opportunities and benefits the people," he said. He added that Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) would be part of India "one day".

385.title: Javed Akhtar's 'World needs you in White House' tweet to Michelle goes viral, people react
385.article_body: A tweet by lyricist Javed Akhtar telling ex-US First Lady Michelle Obama that "not only US but the world needs you in White House" went viral. Reacting to it, a user wrote, "What the covfefe is this." Another tweet read, "The confidence I need in...life." "Reminds me of Lalit Modi telling Sushmita Sen to 'reply my SMS'," a user wrote.

386.title: India abstains from voting at UN to debate China's abuse against Uyghur Muslims
386.article_body: India has abstained from voting on a draft resolution in the UN Human Rights Council to debate the human rights situation in China's Xinjiang region. The draft resolution on "holding a debate on the situation of human rights in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China" was rejected after 17 members voted in favour, 19 voted against, and 11 abstentions.

387.title: India lose an ODI on home soil for 1st time in 2022
387.article_body: South Africa defeated India by 9 runs in the rain-curtailed first ODI in Lucknow on Thursday. With this, India suffered their first defeat in ODI cricket on home soil in 2022. South Africa put up a total of 249/4 in their 40 overs and restricted India to 240/8. The match witnessed Sanju Samson register his highest ODI score (86*).

388.title: Hinduphobia has no place in our society: UK's Labour Party leader
388.article_body: UK's Opposition Labour Party leader Keir Starmer has said "Hinduphobia has absolutely no place in our society", as he vowed to end "divisive politics" in the country. "I want to...thank the Hindu community for your contribution to Britain, for everything you do for us," he said. Starmer's comments came following recent communal clashes in Leicester and Birmingham.

389.title: Oil prices at 3-week high as OPEC+ cuts production by 2 mn barrels/day
389.article_body: Oil prices jumped to three-week high on Thursday after Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies agreed to cut oil production by two million barrels/day. Brent crude futures jumped by 0.9% to $94.25 per barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude was up 0.9% at $88.55 per barrel. Reportedly, the production cut will go into effect from November.

390.title: Tiger enters MANIT campus; classes shifted to online mode
390.article_body: A tiger entered the campus of Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology (MANIT) in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh on Thursday, forcing classes to be held in the online mode. MANIT Registrar Binod Doley said the Forest Department officials had spotted the tiger's pugmarks. He said cages were set up and cameras were installed to monitor the tiger's movements.

391.title: 3 gather on hilltop for online study, struck by lightning in Odisha
391.article_body: Three school students aged between 17-18 were struck by lightning on Wednesday after they gathered on a hilltop for online study owing to poor internet connectivity at Mundagam village, Odisha. Their parents found them in an unconscious state on the hilltop near Mundagam. They're currently in a hospital. Kandhamal's Chief District Medical Officer Manoj Upadhyay said their condition is stable.

392.title: Bihar man tied to tree, beaten to death by villagers for raping 9-yr-old
392.article_body: A man in Bihar's Katihar was tied to a tree and beaten to death by villagers for allegedly raping a nine-year-old girl. The accused silently took the girl to an isolated spot while she was sleeping with her mother in her house. He was caught red-handed when the girl's mother and villagers reached the spot after hearing her cries.

393.title: 3 to 4 farmers commit suicide in Maharashtra everyday: Ajit Pawar
393.article_body: Former Maharashtra minister Ajit Pawar on Thursday claimed three to four farmers were committing suicide in the state everyday since the new government led by CM Eknath Shinde came to power. He further accused the government of not declaring a wet drought in some parts of the state. The Nationalist Congress Party leader was addressing a gathering in Baramati.

394.title: Cattle movement curbs to continue in view of lumpy skin disease: Maha minister
394.article_body: Maharashtra Animal Husbandry Minister Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil on Thursday said that restrictions on cattle movement in Maharashtra will continue for one more month in view of the lumpy skin disease. "Vaccination is going on and we are assessing the situation," Vikhe Patil said. "This vaccination drive has helped us keep the deaths to 2,100," he added.

395.title: 'Cataclysmic' pair of stars that orbit each other in less than an hour discovered
395.article_body: Astronomers have discovered a pair of stars with an extremely short orbit that appear to circle each other every 51 minutes. The system could be a "cataclysmic variable," in which a sun-like star orbits tightly around a white dwarf, a hot, dense core of a burned-out star. In next 70 million years, their orbital period would reduce to 18 minutes.

396.title: Man stabbed after dispute over alleged molestation of girls at garba event in Rajasthan
396.article_body: A man was stabbed after a dispute over alleged molestation of girls during a garba program in Bikaner in Rajasthan, ANI reported. According to Bikaner Police, two accused named Gautam and Sameer Nadsa were arrested while a minor was also detained on the complaint of Madhusudan Modi. The victim is currently in ICU in PBM hospital, reports said.

397.title: BRS has no plans to contest K'taka Assembly polls: HD Kumaraswamy
397.article_body: JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy on Thursday said that Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS), led by Telangana CM KCR, has no intention to contest Assembly polls in Karnataka. BRS may support JD(S) in "15-20 Telugu-speaking" Assembly constituencies in Karnataka bordering Telangana, Kumaraswamy said. Kumaraswamy ruled out any intention to go to national politics and said his strength and fight is in Karnataka.

398.title: AAP releases 4th list of 12 candidates for Gujarat elections
398.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Thursday released its fourth list of 12 candidates for the Gujarat Assembly elections. The party has nominated a retired teacher named Nirmalsinh Parmar from Himatnagar and businessman Doulat Patel from Gandhinagar (South). An industrialist named Kuldeep Vaghela, tribal leader Pankaj Patel and an arts teacher named Dinesh Baria are also included in the list.

399.title: Reflections from Mars not caused due to water: Scientists
399.article_body: Scientists have said that reflections on the surface of Mars under its south pole could be caused by layers of ice and carbon dioxide and not by water. "On Earth, reflections that are bright are often an indication of liquid water, even buried lakes...But on Mars...it should be too cold for similar lakes to form," a researcher said.

400.title: Magna to invest over $120 million for new engineering centre in Bengaluru
400.article_body: Canadian auto parts maker Magna said that it has planned to invest over $120 million to establish a new engineering centre in Bengaluru. Magna said that the facility will serve as a key centre in powertrain electrification, electronics and software-defined vehicle development. The facility is expected to open in the first quarter of next year.

401.title: Heard 'GodFather' is doing well, God bless you: Salman to Chiranjeevi
401.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to Instagram and posted a video congratulating actor Chiranjeevi on the success of GodFather. "I heard that GodFather is doing really well. Congrats. God bless you," Salman could be heard saying in the video. As per the makers, 'GodFather' collected ₹38 crore worldwide on the first day. Salman has a cameo in the film.
